thread.title: Redskins linebacker Trent Murphy reportedly is facing PED suspension
thread.title_full: Redskins linebacker Trent Murphy reportedly is facing PED suspension

title: Redskins linebacker Trent Murphy reportedly is facing PED suspension
text:
Mar 5, 2017 at 9:17p ET 0Shares 
The Washington Redskins might not have one of their top pass rushers to start next season. Linebacker Trent Murphy tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs and is facing a four-game suspension, the Washington Post reported Sunday. 
According to the report, Murphy is appealing the suspension. The 26-year-old linebacker, who has increased his sack totals each of his first three years in the league, had a breakout season in 2016, finishing second on the Redskins with nine sacks. 
Prior to last season, Murphy had somewhat underachieved. The former second-round pick out of Stanford had six sacks in 31 games before 2016, when he combined with Ryan Kerrigan and Preston Smith to form an imposing pass-rushing trio.
